title: datalad CMD -d^ fullpath in a subdir of a subdataset fails to find a dataset
body:
```shell
/tmp > datalad create /tmp/testds
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/testds 
create(ok): /tmp/testds (dataset)                                                                                              

/tmp > datalad create -d /tmp/testds subds
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/testds/subds 
create(ok): subds (dataset)                                                                                                    
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  create (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)

/tmp > mkdir /tmp/testds/subds/subdir

/tmp > cd /tmp/testds/subds/subdir

/tmp/testds/subds/subdir > touch 123

/tmp/testds/subds/subdir > datalad save -d^ $PWD/123
[ERROR  ] No installed dataset found at /tmp/testds/subds/subdir. [dataset.py:require_dataset:596] (ValueError) 

exit:1 /tmp/testds/subds/subdir > datalad --version
datalad 0.12.0rc5.dev102
```

neither with a relative path to the file 

```shell

/tmp/testds/subds/subdir > datalad save -d^ 123     
[ERROR  ] No installed dataset found at /tmp/testds/subds/subdir. [dataset.py:require_dataset:596] (ValueError) 

exit: 1/tmp/testds/subds/subdir >
```

things seems to work out ok when I go upstairs to the root of the subds

```shell

exit:1 /tmp/testds/subds/subdir > cd ..

/tmp/testds/subds > touch 124

/tmp/testds/subds > datalad save -d^ 124
add(ok): 124 (file)                     
save(ok): subds (dataset)
add(ok): subds (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  save (ok: 2)
```

ha -- actually discovered that `save` works out fine with a relative path!:

```shell
/tmp/testds/subds > cd subdir 

/tmp/testds/subds/subdir > datalad save 123    
add(ok): subdir/123 (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
```

time to create a new label "absolute paths" ;)

Removing `-d^` removes some confusion:
```
/tmp/testds/subds/subdir > touch 124

/tmp/testds/subds/subdir > datalad save $PWD/124
add(ok): subdir/124 (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
```
and seems to be specific to `^` (or just going up into parent's dataset) since works fine for `-d ..`:
```shell
/tmp/testds/subds/subdir > touch 126                  

/tmp/testds/subds/subdir > datalad save -d .. $PWD/126
add(ok): subdir/126 (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
```
